results.title: Thunderbirds are go
results.creator_credit: David Lane, Sylvia Anderson and Associated Television (Overseas) Ltd
results.brief_description: The Tracy team launch a highly dangerous rescue mission in space in this first feature-length Thunderbirds classic. SZero X, a 21st century spacecraft, is suddenly blasted by a strange explosion as it leaves the Earth’s atmosphere bound for Mars. Is it sabotage? Can the Thunderbirds discover the perpetrators and save the next launch? This adventure film is gadget loaded and features visual effects by Derek Meddings as well as sound effects by some of London’s famous rock stars, including Cliff Richards.

results.title: Thunderball (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Terence Young, Kevin McClory, Eon Productions and Danjaq
results.brief_description: Thunderball is the fourth Bond film with Sean Connery playing British secret service agent 007, pitting his stylish form against the espionage organisation SPECTRE (Special Executive for Counter-Terrorism, Revenge and Extortion), with Emilio Largo at the helm. SPECTRE plans to hijack a nuclear bomb, plant it under the sea, and then hold the world for ransom. Set in the Bahamas, “Thunderball” provides plenty of lush scenery with spectacular beaches, sprawling mansions and beautiful women in bathing costumes. The under water setting allows for some spectacular ideas and elaborate set pieces. Typical Bond touches include a myriad of one liners and nubile lady friends including a masseuse; Largo’s mistress; a British spy; and an enemy agent. Highlights include a Mardi Gras sequence with James evading capture due to a frenetic, chaotic moment. Other fine moments are the irascible Q displaying Bond’s latest gadgets whilst whingeing about being dragged to the Bahamas in order to do so. Re-made in 1993 as “Never say never again.”

results.title: Thumpalong
results.creator_credit: Peter Nicholson, Peter Nicholson Productions and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Using vibrant colours, this hand drawn animated film by Peter Nicholson tells the story about an old king who hates music, and a wonderous character called Thumpalong, who is an amazing “One Man Band”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Nicholson, Peter Nicholson Productions and Australian Film Commission

results.title: Thumbelina
results.brief_description: A beautifully animated puppet version of Hans Christian Andersen’s beloved tale of the graceful little maiden no bigger than your thumb. Escaping from marriage to an ugly toad, Thumbelina finds refuge with a good natured field mouse who arranges a marriage between Thumbelina and a mole. With the help of a swallow, Thumbelina escapes to a far away land where she finds happiness with the King of the Flower Angels.

results.title: Thumbelina
results.creator_credit: Gary Goldman, Don Bluth, John Pomeroy and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Hans Christian Andersen’s classic fairy tale tells the story of a tiny girl called Thumbelina. One magical night she meets Prince Cornelius, an enchanted fairy as tiny as herself, and she is sure she has found true love. Before their romance can blossom, she is kidnapped by a show business family of toads, waylaid by a scheming beetle and betrothed to a befuddled mole. Thumbelina’s journey home is fraught with adventure, but at last she comes to believe that if she follows her heart, nothing is impossible. Music by Barry Manilow. Features the voices of Jodie Benson, Carole Channing and John Hurt.

results.title: Thumbelina
results.creator_credit: Lotte Reiniger, BBC-TV and Primrose Productions
results.brief_description: Hans Christian Anderson’s fairy tale retold in animated silhouettes. Lotte Reiniger developed this technique in Germany in the 1920’s and produced several silhouette films in the 1950’s for BBC Television. Designed and animated by Lotte Reiniger.

results.title: Thugs of the Forest
results.creator_credit: SKA TV, Campbell Manderson and Pip Starr
results.brief_description: An expose of the attack on Goolengook protesters who were ambushed in the middle of the night by a group of angry foresters.Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994. WARNING : STRONG LANGUAGE - NOT suitable for General Audience

results.title: Thru the mirror (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Mickey Mouse falls asleep reading Lewis Carroll’s ‘Alice Through the Looking Glass’ and dreams himself into wonderland. Features Mickey in 1930’s dance routine. Notable for virtuoso Disney animation techniques, anticipating the design and devices used in the later feature version of Alice in Wonderland.

results.title: Thrownness
results.brief_description:
Two people are thrown into a strange, mysterious place where nothing is as it appears to be and where the relation between cause and effect is never stable. As they explore their surroundings they discover that space, time and themselves are elements of a carefully constructed illusion. Thrownness has been inspired by Matthew Arnold’s poem, ‘Dover Beach’ and philosopher Martin Heidegger. Arnold’s poem of 1867 has surprising contemporary relevance in a time where ‘ignorant armies clash by night’. The romantic photography reminiscent of 1950 Technicolor films, fantastical sets inspired by Fellini’s films and the use of old style in-camera effects create an intriguing, magical aesthetic.

As viewers Thrownness asks us to consider our role in creating narrative coherence through our understanding of cinematic traditions and visual language. The story has an integral, essential and evolving relationship with the elements that create it. The effect of this is the generation of an unexpected alternative narrative which reveals the complex artifice that is the film language.
